item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, March 29, 2025 at 1:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Is AI the new research scientist? Not so, according to a human-led study (17 points | 6 comments)
2. We hacked Gemini's Python sandbox and leaked its source code (at least some) (404 points | 84 comments)
3. Noise cancellation improves turn-taking for AI Voice Agents (18 points | 2 comments)
4. Digital Echoes and Unquiet Minds (94 points | 52 comments)
5. Show HN: An Almost Free, Open Source TURN Server (47 points | 10 comments)
6. NSA F9T53 Opsec Special Bulletin: Signal Vulnerability (5 points | 1 comment)
7. Xee: A Modern XPath and XSLT Engine in Rust (280 points | 143 comments)
8. xAI has acquired X, xAI now valued at $80B (378 points | 401 comments)
9. DIY PTP Grandmaster Clock with a Raspberry Pi (27 points | 7 comments)
10. How Kerala got rich (300 points | 171 comments)
11. How to write blog posts that developers read (316 points | 108 comments)
12. iCloud Mail has DNS misconfigured (5 points | 3 comments)
13. Finley (YC W21) Is Hiring a Technical Implementations Specialist ( | hide)
14. Optimizing Matrix Multiplication on RDNA3 (50 points | 7 comments)
15. Show HN: Hexi – Modern header-only network binary serialisation for C++ (70 points | 29 comments)
16. Decomposing a Factorial into Large Factors (100 points | 23 comments)
17. The Real Book (2021) (83 points | 21 comments)
18. The Art of DJing: Avalon Emerson (2019) (69 points | 32 comments)
19. Plasmonic Modulators Can Break the Wireless Terahertz Barrier (10 points | 1 comment)
20. Building a modern durable execution engine from first principles (60 points | 12 comments)
21. Madison Square Garden's surveillance banned this fan over his T-shirt design (25 points | 6 comments)
22. Swiftly 1.0 (107 points | 29 comments)
23. SignalBotOne – Notification Webhooks for Signal (51 points | 35 comments)
24. Superhyperbola (42 points | 12 comments)
25. I asked police to send me their public surveillance footage of my car (500 points | 401 comments)
26. Ask HN: can Wireless-CarPlay dongles steal your data? (31 points | 13 comments)
27. Building Statically Linked Go Executables with CGO and Zig (102 points | 14 comments)
28. Cross-Platform P2P Wi-Fi: How the EU Killed AWDL (183 points | 105 comments)
29. The Biology of B-Movie Monsters (2003) (63 points | 35 comments)
30. A cretaceous fly trap? Remarkable abdominal modification in a fossil wasp (25 points | 4 comments)
